p: The top SNPs identified by machine learning were selected by the permutation-based p-value threshold defined above for MB-MDR (padj < 1), empirically by taking the extreme tail of the distribution for SHAP values (μ | SHAP | > 0.0005) in gradient boosting (Supplementary Fig. 4), summed weights (padj < 0.05) for neural networks (Supplementary Fig. 5), and by applying the Boruta algorithm67 (gradient boosting models only). Only SNPs which were present in top SNPs for at least two train-test random data splits of a given method were prioritised. Details on predictor selection are given in Supplementary sections 1.6 and 2.2-2.4.
